page.title: 02Living in a village.
page.content: Living in a small village has its rewards but also its difficulties. Great Horwood has two small shops, one which also acts as a Post Office, two Public houses and a garage, formerly the blacksmiths', which no longer sells petrol.For most things, weekly shopping, doctors, dentists and secondary schools a journey away from the village is needed. Although secondary pupils are bussed to school, there are few public transport facilities. Private cars are essential, although some people cycle or walk to the nearest town,Winslow, some two miles distant. Mobile services provide library facilities and there is even a mobile gymnasium for the keep-fit enthusiasts.
